âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Advanced image manipulation â€¢ Basic tools (crop, draw) â€¢ Filters â€¢ OCR â€¢ Image processing options
ðŸ“– Summary: Image Toolbox is a powerful Android application built with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose, offering advanced image manipulation capabilities. It provides a wide array of features, from basic editing tools to sophisticated AI-powered functions like background removal and upscaling.

ðŸš€ LiveContainer | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Running multiple iOS applications on a device without adhering to standard installation or app ID limitations, particularly for development or testing purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Run iOS apps without installing them â€¢ Install unlimited apps with a single app ID â€¢ Support for multiple versions of an app with separate data containers â€¢ Bypass codesigning with JIT enabled
ðŸ“– Summary: LiveContainer is an app launcher for iOS that allows users to run multiple iOS applications without needing to install each one individually. It bypasses typical app installation limits and signing requirements, especially when Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation is available, offering a way to manage and launch apps more flexibly.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ DrawPen | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Annotating the screen during presentations, tutorials, or general screen sharing to highlight information or add visual cues.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Screen annotation tool â€¢ Cross-platform availability (macOS, Windows, Linux) â€¢ Drawing, shapes, text, and highlighter tools â€¢ Laser pointer and eraser functionality â€¢ Customizable pen thickness and color
ðŸ“– Summary: DrawPen is an open-source screen annotation tool available for macOS, Windows, and Linux. It allows users to draw, add shapes, text, and highlights directly on their screen, with a laser pointer and eraser functionality for presentations and general annotation needs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ picoshare | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Self-hosting a simple and efficient file-sharing service for any type of file, with direct download links and no content modification.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Minimalist file sharing service â€¢ Easy to host â€¢ Direct download links â€¢ No file restrictions (any file type/size) â€¢ No resizing or re-encoding of media files
ðŸ“– Summary: PicoShare is a minimalist, self-hostable file-sharing service written in Go. It provides direct download links for any file type and size without re-encoding or resizing, ensuring users receive their files exactly as uploaded. It supports local storage and cloud data replication via Litestream for persistence.

ðŸ’¡ Nook | Swift
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A desktop web browser for macOS with an alternative tab management interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Sidebar-first navigation (vertical tabs) â€¢ Performance optimization with modern macOS APIs â€¢ Minimal and modern UI focused on content
ðŸ“– Summary: Nook is a fast, minimal web browser for macOS designed with a unique sidebar-first interface. It prioritizes performance and a clean user experience, leveraging modern macOS APIs for efficiency.
